devdoc.details: Social recovery module enabling account reconfiguration through a timelocked guardian-based consensus mechanism. Provides M-of-N guardian multi-signature with timelock protection, recovery cancellation, and configurable security parameters.

AddressEmptyCode(address).details: There's no code at `target` (it is not a contract).

FailedCall().details: A call to an address target failed. The target may have reverted.

InsufficientBalance(uint256,uint256).details: The ETH balance of the account is not enough to perform the operation.

InvalidAccountNonce(address,uint256).details: The nonce used for an `account` is not the expected current nonce.

EIP712DomainChanged().details: MAY be emitted to signal that the domain could have changed.

addGuardian(address).details: Adds a new guardian to the account's recovery configuration. Only callable by the account itself.

cancelRecovery().custom:security: Direct account control takes precedence over recovery process
cancelRecovery().details: Cancels an ongoing recovery process. Can only be called by the account itself for self-cancellation.

cancelRecovery(address,(bytes,address)[].custom:security: Uses same signature threshold and verification process as recovery initiation
cancelRecovery(address,(bytes,address)[].details: Allows guardians to cancel a recovery process. Requires threshold signatures from guardians, similar to starting recovery. Uses same signature threshold and verification process as recovery initiation.

params.account: The account to cancel recovery for
params.guardianSignatures: Array of guardian signatures authorizing cancellation, sorted by signer address

constructor.details: Initializes the module with a name and version.

eip712Domain().details: returns the fields and values that describe the domain separator used by this contract for EIP-712 signature.

executeRecovery(address,bytes).custom:security: Validates execution matches the hash committed during startRecovery and resets recovery state afterward
executeRecovery(address,bytes).details: Executes the recovery process after timelock period has passed. Only callable when recovery status is Ready. Validates that execution matches the hash committed during startRecovery and resets recovery state afterward.

params.account: The account to execute recovery for
params.executionCalldata: The calldata to execute, must match the pending recovery hash stored during startRecovery

getGuardians(address).details: Gets all guardians for an ERC-7579 Account.

params.account: The ERC-7579 Account to get guardians for

getMaxGuardians().details: Gets the maximum number of guardians for an ERC-7579 Account.

getRecoveryStatus(address).details: Gets the current recovery status of an ERC-7579 Account. Determines status based on recoveryStart timestamp and timelock duration.

params.account: The ERC-7579 Account to get the recovery status for

returns._0: Status enum value: NotStarted (0), Started (1), or Ready (2)

getThreshold(address).details: Gets the threshold for an ERC-7579 Account.

params.account: The ERC-7579 Account to get the threshold for

getTimelock(address).details: Gets the timelock for an ERC-7579 Account.

params.account: The ERC-7579 Account to get the timelock for

isGuardian(address,address).details: Checks if an address is a guardian for an ERC-7579 Account.

params.account: The ERC-7579 Account to check guardians for
params.guardian: The address to check as a guardian

returns._0: true if the address is a guardian, false otherwise

isModuleType(uint256).details: Returns boolean value if module is a certain type

params.moduleTypeId: the module type ID according the ERC-7579 spec MUST return true if the module is of the given type and false otherwise

nonces(address).details: Returns the next unused nonce for an address.

onInstall(bytes).details: This function is called by the smart account during installation of the module

params.data: arbitrary data that may be required on the module during `onInstall` initialization MUST revert on error (e.g. if module is already enabled)

onUninstall(bytes).details: This function is called by the smart account during uninstallation of the module

params.data: arbitrary data that may be required on the module during `onUninstall` de-initialization MUST revert on error

removeGuardian(address).details: Removes a guardian from the account's recovery configuration. Only callable by the account itself.

params.guardian: Address of the guardian to remove

startRecovery(address,(bytes,address)[],.custom:security: Uses EIP-712 for signature verification and nonces for replay protection
startRecovery(address,(bytes,address)[],.details: Starts the recovery process for an ERC-7579 Account. Requires threshold number of valid guardian signatures and commits the hash of the approved execution calldata for recovery.

params.account: The ERC-7579 Account to start recovery for
params.executionCalldata: The calldata to execute during recovery. This defines the account reconfiguration to perform.
params.guardianSignatures: Array of guardian signatures authorizing the recovery. Each signature contains a signature and the signer's address, sorted by signer address in ascending order.

updateThreshold(uint256).details: Changes the number of required guardian signatures. Only callable by the account itself.

updateTimelock(uint256).details: Changes the timelock duration for recovery. Only callable by the account itself.

devdoc.title: Social Recovery Executor Module
